availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
District of Columbia
County of Washington } SS.

I, Charles Walter, duly appointed by the Governor of the State of Kentucky, a Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky, resident at the City of Washington, in the District of Columbia, do solemnly swear, that I will well and faithfully execute and perform all the duties of such commissioner, under and by virtue of the laws of said State of Kentucky --

Charles Walter
Commissioner for Kentucky
in Washington D. C.
C W
Sept
28/64

Sworn and subscribed before me this 28th day of September A. D. 1864 --
Chs. McNamee, N. P. D. C.

figure.ab:
CHARLES MCNAMEE
NOTARY PUBLIC
WASHINGTON D. C.

body.p:
District Columbia
Comr Deeds
Oath of Charles Walter
Filed 3d Oct/64
